安装
合身
合适的
恰当的
合身的
健壮的
合身
适合
匹配
发作
fabrication, integration and test 制作
Fiji Institute of Technology 斐济技术协会
Fellow of the Institute of Transport 运输协会会员
finite integration technique 有限集成技术

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使适合，适应"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: adapt, adjust, conform, accommodate, suit, fit
means: adapt ：指人或物在原有情况下作某些改变以适应新的环境或不同的条件，强调改变的目的和重要性。
adjust与adapt含义很接近，但adjust所改变的幅度要小一些，侧重过程，主要用于调整角度、高度、光点等。
conform ：多指与某模式或规则相符，也引申指改变习惯等以适应新的环境。
accommodate ：书面用词，指以外部条件标准改变自己或某事以求得适应，着重改变或调节的有利。
suit ：指适合要求，从而使人满意愉快。
fit ：含义广，指人或物适合或适应某一目的或用途。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均表示"适当的"或"适合的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: fit, proper, suitable, appropriate, apt, fitting
means: fit ： 指具有适合于某个目的，某种工作或某种用途等必需的品质或条件。
proper ： 往往侧重于符合某个标准或习惯。
suitable ： 指具有适合于某种特定场合、地位或情况等的品质。
appropriate ： 指专门适合于某人或某事，语气较重，强调"恰如其分"。
apt ： 专指性质或构造适合达到某一目的或得到某种结果的要求。
fitting ： 指与当时的目标、情绪状态、气氛、场合等相适应。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"健康的，强健的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: healthy, sound, robust, well, strong, vigorous, sturdy, tough, wholesome, fit
means: healthy ： 指身体无病，也可指身心健全、正常的。
sound ： 侧重身体各部分或器官没有病，无任何缺陷，即健康。
robust ： 强调身体强健。
well ： 仅指没有疾病，但不一定很健康。
strong ： 既指体格健壮，又指体力或精神上的力量。
vigorous ： 指人强健有力，精力充沛。
sturdy ： 侧重于结实的体格。
tough ： 着重指人的体格健壮。
wholesome ： 多指能给人留下身体健康、思想健全或品德良好等印象。
fit ： 既可指健壮又可指健全无病。

word_mean: 发作：以不恰当的和不自主的动作或精神活动为特征的发作。另见epilepsy
适合：一结构适合于另一结构，如牙的修复适合于该牙在口内的位置

sentence.Network_en: Police have released an E-fit picture of the suspected gunman.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方已公布持枪嫌犯的电子画像。

sentence.Network_en: She made a New Year's resolution to get fit.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的新年决心是要保持身材健美。

sentence.Network_en: There's something about the way he talks of her that doesn't fit.
sentence.Network_cn: 他谈论她的样子有点不对劲。

jx.jx_en_mean: consider it correct or acceptable to do something

lj.lj_ly: why did the company see fit to give you the job?.
lj.lj_ls: 为什么这家公司认为把这份工作给你很合适？。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)使大为震惊；使恶心；惹恼，激怒
(非正式)大吃一惊，很意外；很生气，恼怒
(非正式)愉悦的，开心的，高兴的

lj.lj_ly: he had us all in fits.
lj.lj_ls: 他让我们大家都非常开心。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 断断续续地，间歇性地，一阵阵地，不时地

lj.lj_ly: the machine tends to go forward in fits and starts.
lj.lj_ls: 这机器往往是时断时续地前进。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a person) be socially compatible with other members of a group

lj.lj_ly: he feels he should become tough to &B{fit in with} his friends.
lj.lj_ls: 他认为自己该强硬起来，好与朋友们保持一致。

jx.jx_en_mean: find room or have sufficient space for someone or something

lj.lj_ly: can you fit any more water into the jug?.
lj.lj_ls: 你还能往水壶里再加点水吗？。

jx.jx_en_mean: provide with the necessary equipment, supplies, clothes, or other items for a particular situation

lj.lj_ly: the cabin had been fitted out to a high standard.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)incriminate someone by falsifying evidence against them
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)伪造证据诬陷某人

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: of unknown origin
Old English fitt 'conflict', in Middle English 'position of danger or excitement', also 'short period'; the sense 'sudden attack of illness' dates from the mid 16th cent
Old English fitt, perhaps the same word as fit, or related to German Fitze 'skein of yarn', in the obsolete sense 'thread with which weavers mark off a day's work'

collins.item: BEING RIGHT OR GOING IN THE RIGHT PLACE

entry.def: If something fits, it is the right size and shape to go onto a person's body or onto a particular object.

example.ex: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child...
example.tran: 腰带、和服和其他衣服都是儿童款的。

example.ex: She has to go to the men's department to find trousers that fit at the waist...
example.tran: 她得去男装部找一条腰围合适的裤子。

entry.def: If something is a good fit, it fits well.

example.ex: Eventually he was happy that the sills and doors were a reasonably good fit.
example.tran: 门槛和门扇算是贴合良好，他终于开心了。

entry.def: If you are fitted for a particular piece of clothing, you try it on so that the person who is making it can see where it needs to be altered.

example.ex: She was being fitted for her wedding dress.
example.tran: 她正在试穿婚纱。

entry.tran: 适合放置(于);为放置(于…)而设计
entry.def: If something fits somewhere, it can be put there or is designed to be put there.

example.ex: ...a pocket computer which is small enough to fit into your pocket...
example.tran: 小得能够放进衣袋里的袖珍电脑

example.ex: He folded his long legs to fit under the table...
example.tran: 他把两条长腿蜷起来伸进桌下。

entry.def: If you fit something into a particular space or place, you put it there.

example.ex: She fitted her key in the lock...
example.tran: 她把钥匙插进锁孔。

example.ex: Who could cut the millions of stone blocks and fit them together?...
example.tran: 谁能切割出这数百万块的石块，再把它们堆叠起来呢？

entry.def: If you fit something somewhere, you attach it there, or put it there carefully and securely.

example.ex: Fit hinge bolts to give extra support to the door lock...
example.tran: 安上铰链插销，让门锁更牢靠。

example.ex: Peter had built the overhead ladders, and the next day he fitted them to the wall...
example.tran: 彼得已经搭好了攀爬横梯，第二天便把它们安在了墙上。

entry.def: If something fits something else or fits into it, it goes together well with that thing or is able to be part of it.

example.ex: Her daughter doesn't fit the current feminine ideal...
example.tran: 她女儿并不符合当今的完美女性标准。

example.ex: Fostering is a full-time job and you should carefully consider how it will fit into your career...
example.tran: 抚养孩子是全天候的事，应该仔细考虑如何将它与事业协调起来。

entry.def: You can say that something fits a particular person or thing when it is appropriate or suitable for them or it.

example.ex: The punishment must always fit the crime.
example.tran: 必须始终坚持罪罚相当的原则。

entry.def: If something is fit for a particular purpose, it is suitable for that purpose.

example.ex: Of the seven bicycles we had, only two were fit for the road.
example.tran: 我们的7辆自行车中，只有两辆适合走这种路。

example.ex: ...safety measures intended to reassure consumers that the meat is fit to eat...
example.tran: 旨在让消费者放心食用这些肉的安全措施

entry.def: If someone is fit to do something, they have the appropriate qualities or skills that will allow them to do it.

example.ex: You're not fit to be a mother!...
example.tran: 你不配做母亲！

example.ex: In a word, this government isn't fit to rule...
example.tran: 简言之，这届政府无法胜任治国之责。

entry.def: If something fits someone for a particular task or role, it makes them good enough or suitable for it.

example.ex: ...a man whose past experience fits him for the top job in education...
example.tran: 一个资历丰富、适合担任教育界最高职位的人

example.ex: It is not a person's gender that fits them to be a vicar but what is in their hearts.
example.tran: 一个人是否胜任教区牧师一职取决于其品德而不是其性别。

entry.def: If you describe someone as fit, you mean that they are good-looking.

example.ex: About an hour later a really fit guy came up to me on the dance floor.
example.tran: 大概过了一个小时，一个长相非常俊美的男人在舞池里向我走过来。

entry.def: If you say that something or someone is fit to produce some extreme result, you are emphasizing the extreme nature of that thing or that person's activity.

example.ex: The stink was fit to knock you down.
example.tran: 这臭味简直要把人熏倒。

example.ex: ...hour after hour, the same exercises until you're fit to drop!
example.tran: 一小时又一小时地做着同一套动作，直到快要晕倒！

entry.tran: (表示不赞成)决定，选择，认为做…合适
entry.def: If you say that someone sees fit to do something, you mean that they are entitled to do it, but that you disapprove of their decision to do it.

example.ex: He's not a friend, you say, yet you saw fit to lend him money.
example.tran: 你说他不是朋友，但你却决定借钱给他。

entry.tran: 找到时间(见某人);安排时间(做某事)
entry.def: If you manage to fit a person or task in, you manage to find time to deal with them.

example.ex: We work long hours both outside and inside the home and we rush around trying to fit everything in...
example.tran: 我们家里家外长时间忙活，忙完这里忙那里，想把一切都搞定。

example.ex: I find that I just can't fit in regular domestic work.
example.tran: 我发现我真的没有时间做日常家务。

entry.def: If you fit in as part of a group, you seem to belong there because you are similar to the other people in it.

example.ex: She was great with the children and fitted in beautifully.
example.tran: 她和孩子们打交道很有一手,相处得十分融洽。

entry.tran: (在某种情形或体系中)发挥作用，担当职责;适合;符合
entry.def: If you say that someone or something fits in, you understand how they form part of a particular situation or system.

example.ex: He knew where I fitted in and what he had to do to get the best out of me...
example.tran: 他知道我适合做什么，也知道他要怎么做才能让我发挥出最佳水平。

example.ex: This fits in with what you've told me.
example.tran: 这与你告诉过我的相符。

entry.tran: 融入;与…相处融洽(或和谐)
entry.def: If you fit into a particular group, you seem to belong there because you are similar to the other people in it.

example.ex: It's hard to see how he would fit into the team.
example.tran: 很难看出他将如何融入这支队伍。

entry.tran: 归属，适于(某种情形或体系)
entry.def: If something fits into a particular situation or system, that seems to be the right place for it.

example.ex: Most film locations broadly fit into two categories; those on private property and those in a public place.
example.tran: 多数电影的拍摄场地大致归为两类：私人宅院与公共场地。

entry.tran: 为…提供装备;供给…必要的东西
entry.def: If you fit someone or something out, or you fit them up, you provide them with equipment and other things that they need.

example.ex: We helped to fit him out for a trip to the Baltic...
example.tran: 我们帮他准备了去波罗的海的行装。

example.ex: I suggest we fit you up with an office suite...
example.tran: 我建议我们给你配备一间办公套房。

entry.def: If someone fits another person up, they try to make it seem that that person is responsible for a crime.

example.ex: Mr Stone said inmates who had given evidence were trying to 'fit him up'...
example.tran: 斯通先生说那些提供证据的同狱犯人是在试图“诬陷他”。

example.ex: There can never be any legitimate basis for police officers to fit up suspects they 'know' to be guilty.
example.tran: 警官诬陷那些他们“知道”犯了罪的嫌疑人是根本没有任何法律依据的。

entry.def: Someone who is fit is healthy and physically strong.

example.ex: An averagely fit person can master easy ski runs within a few days.
example.tran: 健康的普通人几天内就可以掌握简单的滑雪技术。

collins.tran: 无法控制的行动或情感

entry.def: If someone has a fit they suddenly lose consciousness and their body makes uncontrollable movements.

example.ex: About two in every five epileptic fits occur during sleep...
example.tran: 每5例癫痫病中约有两例是在睡眠过程中发作的。

example.ex: Once a fit has started there is nothing you can do to stop it.
example.tran: 痉挛一旦发作就无法止住。

entry.tran: (突然止不住的)一阵(咳嗽、大笑)
entry.def: If you have a fit of coughing or laughter, you suddenly start coughing or laughing in an uncontrollable way.

example.ex: Halfway down the cigarette she had a fit of coughing...
example.tran: 烟抽到一半，她突然一阵猛咳。

example.ex: It was so unreal that I broke into a fit of giggles.
example.tran: 这实在很离奇,我忍不住咯咯笑了起来。

entry.def: If you do something in a fit of anger or panic, you are very angry or afraid when you do it.

example.ex: Pattie shot Tom in a fit of jealous rage.
example.tran: 帕蒂妒火中烧，开枪击中了汤姆。

entry.tran: 大发雷霆;大光其火;大吃一惊
entry.def: If you say that someone will have a fit when they hear about something, you mean that they will be very angry or shocked.

example.ex: Will Mrs Winterton have a fit if we add one more to the guest list at this late stage?...
example.tran: 到这么晚的时候我们再增加一个客人，温特顿太太会发火吗？

example.ex: He'd have a fit if he knew what we were up to!
example.tran: 要是他知道我们在干什么会气疯了的。

entry.def: Someone who is in fits is laughing uncontrollably.

example.ex: He was a much more entertaining person, who used to have us all in fits.
example.tran: 他以前更为风趣，常常让我们大家都捧腹大笑。

entry.def: Something that happens in fits and starts or by fits and starts keeps happening and then stopping again.

example.ex: My slimming attempts tend to go in fits and starts...
example.tran: 我的瘦身运动总是三天打鱼两天晒网。

example.ex: Military technology advances by fits and starts.
example.tran: 军事技术总是间断性地进步着。

means.word_mean: 3. the manner in which something fits;

sentences.sentence: "I admired the fit of her coat"

means.word_mean: 4. a sudden flurry of activity (often for no obvious reason);
2. be the right size or shape; fit correctly or as desired;

sentences.sentence: "This piece won't fit into the puzzle"
"Does this paper meet the requirements for the degree?"
"He fitted other pieces of paper to his cut-out"

means.word_mean: 5. insert or adjust several objects or people;

sentences.sentence: "Can you fit the toy into the box?"
"This man can't fit himself into our work environment"

means.word_mean: 6. be compatible, similar or consistent; coincide in their characteristics;

sentences.sentence: "The two stories don't agree in many details"
"The handwriting checks with the signature on the check"
"The suspect's fingerprints don't match those on the gun"

means.word_mean: 7. conform to some shape or size;
8. provide with (something) usually for a specific purpose;

sentences.sentence: "The expedition was equipped with proper clothing, food, and other necessities"

means.word_mean: 1. meeting adequate standards for a purpose;

sentences.sentence: "it is fit and proper that you be there"

means.word_mean: 2. (usually followed by `to' or `for') on the point of or strongly disposed;

sentences.sentence: "we are set to go at any time"

means.word_mean: 3. physically and mentally sound or healthy;

sentences.sentence: "felt relaxed and fit after their holiday"

list.explanation: [戏剧用语]临时舞台，便携式舞台装置，携带活动舞台装置的巡回旅行剧团

example.en: There are some 40 off-Broadway houses. You might add another 40 off-off-Broad way clubs and fit-ups.
example.zh: 大约有40家外百老汇式的中小剧场。 你也许可以再增加40个比这更具外百老汇性的俱乐部和携带活动舞台装置的旅行剧团。

example.en: We were fitted, you ratbag!Nothing but a lousy fit-up.
example.zh: 我们是被诬陷的，你这下流坯!纯粹是无中生有、卑鄙无耻的捏造罪名。

example.en: I knew you' d throw a fit when I told you.
example.zh: 我就知道我一告诉你,你准会大发脾气。

auth_sentence.content: How does the nuclear plant at Bushehr fit in?
auth_sentence.res_content: How does the nuclear plant at Bushehr fit in?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How does the nuclear plant at Bushehr fit in?

auth_sentence.content: The environment and atmosphere will be a perfect fit.
auth_sentence.res_content: The environment and atmosphere will be a perfect fit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The environment and atmosphere will be a perfect fit.

auth_sentence.content: The data point doesn't fit the evolutionist curve.
auth_sentence.res_content: The data point doesn't fit the evolutionist curve.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The data point doesn't fit the evolutionist curve.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 过滤器；滤波器；滤光器；滤色器

Sentence.sentence: But Oprah's particular brand of celebrity is not a good fit for the values of a university whose motto(座右铭),Veritas,means truth.

Nonetheless, the developers of the Chinatown garage are confident with the technology and are counting on it to squeeze 67 cars in an apartment-building basement that would otherwise fit only 24, accomplished by removing a maneuver space normally required.
He is not fit to study science.

sentences.en: His great height fitted him to play basketball.
sentences.cn: 他的身材高大, 适合打篮球。

sentences.en: The authorities fitted the explorers a fleet.
sentences.cn: 当局为探险者配备了一艘舰艇。
只有符合条件的申请人需要申请。

sentences.en: She is fit for the job.
The water is not fit to drink.

means.word_mean: 恰当的, 正当的, 得体的

sentences.en: It is fit that we give thanks.
The shoes are just your fit.
She fell down in a fit.
She burst into a fit of laughter.
The house fits into the scenery so well that you can hardly see it.
sentences.cn: 这座房子与周围景色十分协调一致，你几乎看不见房子。

jushi.english: This pair of shoes fit perfectly. I will take this pair.
jushi.chinese: 这双鞋大小刚合适,我就买这双了。
